      Handles the refresh process and will return a new access token if successful as well as marking the old access token and refresh token as revoked.

      Handles the revocation process and if successful marking the old access token and any associated refresh token as revoked.
      void tokenFromAuthorizationCode(java.lang.String tokenUri, java.lang.String code, java.lang.String clientId, java.lang.String clientSecret, java.lang.String returnUri, TokenListener listener)
      Exchanges an authorization code for an access token which can be used to authenticate access to services.

    • Method Detail

      • tokenFromAuthorizationCode

        public void tokenFromAuthorizationCode(java.lang.String tokenUri,
                              java.lang.String code,
                              java.lang.String clientId,
                              java.lang.String clientSecret,
                              java.lang.String returnUri,
                              TokenListener listener)
        Exchanges an authorization code for an access token which can be used to authenticate access to services.
        Parameters:
        tokenUri - token endpoint.
        code - as returned from the authorization call.
        clientId - used for HTTP Basic Authorization of the request.
        clientSecret - used for HTTP Basic Authorization of the request.
        returnUri - which is the return point after the user has authenticated/consented.
        listener - It is necessary to implement tokenResponse(JSONObject response) and errorToken(JSONObject error) to manage the response.

      • processTokenResponse

        public void processTokenResponse(org.json.JSONObject response)
        Internal use. Method from the OpenIDConnectCallbackTokenReciever interface to wait the response.

        processTokenResponse in interface OpenIDConnectCallbackTokenReceiver
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
        java.lang.NullPointerException
